definition: scanty/meager
surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]
tiny/miniature/slightly/profound/abtruse/to decline/one millionth part of/micro-/Taiwan pr. [wei2]
meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
see 薄荷[bo4 he5]
surname Bo
thin/cold in manner/indifferent/weak/light/infertile

sentences.english: My small business operates on a razor-thin profit margin.
sentences.chinese: 我的生意屬小本經營，利潤微薄。

sentences.english: I just do something to my meager to serve truth and justice services.
sentences.chinese: 我要做的只是以我微薄的綿力來爲真理和正義服務。

sentences.english: Laura, then 62, was teaching at poverty-level wages.
sentences.chinese: 當時勞拉62歲，還在教書，收入微薄。

sentences.english: His meager wage is not enough to support their five children.
sentences.chinese: 靠他一個人的微薄工資不足以養活他們的五個孩子。

sentences.english: The business world should start to see Twitter as one of the primary consumer communication channels available.
sentences.chinese: 企業應該開始將微薄看做一個基本的客戶交流平臺。

sentences.english: He seems a rich man, but is poverty in practice.
sentences.chinese: 看上去他很有錢，但實際上家資微薄。

sentences.english: He seems to be rich. Actually his family is very poor.
sentences.chinese: 看上去他很有錢，其實家資微薄。

sentences.english: He seems very rich, in fact his family is very poor.
sentences.chinese: 看上去他很有錢，其實家資微薄。

sentences.english: I enclosed a humble contribution towards the funds of your society.
sentences.chinese: 我謹爲貴會的基金奉上一筆微薄的捐款。

sentences.english: I like the hours and the people, but the pay is measly.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡這裏的工作時間和同事，但薪水非常微薄。

sentences.english: The meager profit in the factory has vanished into thin air, due to long funds tied up.
sentences.chinese: 工廠微薄的利潤由於漫長的資金佔壓而消失殆盡。

sentences.english: He looks very rich, in fact he has a thin assets.
sentences.chinese: 看上去他很有錢，其實家資微薄。

sentences.english: For each beloved hour Sharp pittances of years.
sentences.chinese: 爲每一個可愛的時刻必償以多年的微薄薪餉。

sentences.english: Saturn helps direct us back to becoming farmers in our own humble garden plot.
sentences.chinese: 土星直接幫助我們重新回到成爲農民自己的微薄園圃。

sentences.english: The business profit is more and more scanty in the storm of the price.
sentences.chinese: 利潤在這樣的漲價之風中越顯微薄。

sentences.english: I can't support the big family on such a slim income.
sentences.chinese: 靠這點微薄的收入我是不可能養活這一大家子的。

definition: to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
my humble effort/my meager contribution (humble)
to live one's life/to make a living
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to give material assistance to
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
to support one's family (idiom)
to provide for/to keep (animals, a family etc)/to raise animals/to feed and clothe/support/the necessities of life/to give birth
poor but upright/destitute
lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living
livelihood
family livelihood/a household's economic situation/family property
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
